abstract.title: Abstract
abstract.simpara: To provide the fundamentals of the theory of stress and strain analysis. These principles will be used to derive generalized elastic constitutive relations in engineering materials. Prediction of failure of materials as well yielding and failure criteria are incorporated. The course provide the background to deal with advanced topics of solid mechanics for the analysis of industrial structural design problems found in applied engineering. Most notes adapted from cite:[uguralAdvancedMechanicsMaterials2019]. Keywords: Stress, strain, stress-strain relationships, strain energy, failure theories, curved beams, unsymmetrical bending, shear center, torsion of noncircular sections, energy principles, Castigliano’s theorem, inelastic behavior

formalpara.title: Internal Forces
formalpara.para: If we cut a body/element along some plane, then we can look at the forces that act within that plane due to external loadings to observe how the material of the component itself reacts to those loadings. Moments cause the element to bend, and we assume the planes remain plane. Shear causes the faces of the element to pass laterally to other faces, and we assume that planes remain vertical. Normal stresses causes the element to change length, and we assume constant volume (Poisson’s Ratio).
